event.title: Work Visa Application
event.description:
1. Submission: Upload documents online (graduation cert, HKID, Letter of Consent).
2. Processing: Receive approval and pay the fee online <Time: 2-4 weeks>.
3. Mainland Permit: Go to the Shenzhen immigration to update the stay permit <Time: 3-7 workdays>.
4. Activation: Activate the visa through the customs automated gate.

event.title: Work Visa Application (Red Tape)
event.description:
1. Prerequisite Hurdle: Go back to the hometown government physically to transfer records. <Barrier: Physical Presence Required> <Cost: At least 1 week travel>
2. The “Stamp” Hunt: Obtain a stamp for the Letter of Consent from the local unit. <Barrier: Hierarchical Approval> <Action: Book appointment> <Cost: 1 full day queuing>
3. Submission: Upload documents online.
4. Information Black Hole: Wait for a month with zero status updates. <Barrier: Lack of Transparency> <Cost: High Anxiety>
5. Forced Inquiry: Email/Call/Visit HK Immigration office because the system shows nothing. <Action: Active Chasing> <Cost: More Effort/Transport>
6. The “Salami Slicing” Request: Receive email requesting “supplementary materials” that were not listed initially. <Barrier: Hidden Rule/Vague Requirement> <Cost: Wait another 2-4 weeks>
7. Approval: Get the visa and pay.
8. Mainland Delay: Go to Shenzhen immigration to update stay permit, but face longer processing due to “system upgrades”. <Barrier: System Inefficiency> <Cost: 7-10 workdays>
9. Activation: Activate through customs.
